intro: Cissus biternata, commonly known as the three-lobed rock fig, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets with serrated edges. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by edible, fig-like fruits. Cissus biternata thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Its ability to climb and adapt to various environments makes it a resilient and versatile species.
